The '''2nd Airborne Division''' was a [[British Army]] deception unit of World War II. It comprised a small amount of personnel and equipment, especially radio communications, which aimed to mimic the activities of a real, 10,000 strong plus, [[division (military)|division]].
It was 'based' in [[Lincolnshire]] and used as a deception division leading up to D-Day with [[Fourth Army (United Kingdom)|Fourth Army]] of [[First U.S. Army Group]], and then again for the proposed operation around [[Kiel]]-[[Bremen]] when [[Operation Market Garden]] was under way. The division was notionally disbanded in December 1944, as its troops provided replacements for the [[1st Airborne Division (United Kingdom)|1st]] and [[6th Airborne Division (United Kingdom)|6th Airborne]] Divisions. <ref name="holt" />

* 11th Parachute Brigade * 12th Parachute Brigade * 13th Airlanding Brigade
